cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}to have possession or ownership of or have at one's disposal

dt.t: the bank {wi}holds{/wi} the title to the car

dt: {bc}to have as a privilege or position of responsibility
{bc}to have as a mark of distinction

dt.t: the only restraining motive which may {wi}hold{/wi} the hand of a tyrant
ask them to {wi}hold{/wi} a room for us
I'll have a hot dog, and {wi}hold{/wi} the mustard

dt: {bc}to make liable or accountable or bound to an obligation
{bc}to have or maintain in the grasp

dt.t: this is how you {wi}hold{/wi} the racket

dt: {bc}to support in a particular position or keep from falling or moving

dt.t: {wi}hold{/wi} me up so I can see
a clamp {wi}holds{/wi} the whole thing together
can the roof {wi}hold{/wi} all of that weight

dt: {bc}to prevent from leaving or getting away

dt.t: how long can you {wi}hold{/wi} your breath

dt: {bc}to restrain as or as if a captive
{bc}to enclose and keep in a container or within bounds {bc}{sx|contain||}

dt.t: this corral will not {wi}hold{/wi} all of the horses

dt: {bc}to be able to consume easily or without undue effect
{bc}to be able to drink (alcoholic beverages) without becoming noticeably drunk
{bc}to have as a principal or essential feature or attribute

dt.t: the book {wi}holds{/wi} a number of surprises
no one knows what the future {wi}holds{/wi}

dt: {bc}to have in the mind or express as a judgment, opinion, or belief

dt.t: I {wi}hold{/wi} the view that this is wrong
{wi}holding{/wi} that it is nobody's business but his
in America they {wi}hold{/wi} everything you say against you

dt: {bc}to think of in a particular way {bc}{sx|regard||}
{bc}to assemble for and carry on the activity of
{bc}to produce or sponsor especially as a public exhibition
{bc}to maintain occupation, control, or defense of
{bc}to resist the offensive efforts or advance of

dt.t: {it}held{/it} the opposing team to just two points

dt: {bc}to maintain (a certain condition, situation, or course of action) without change
{bc}to cover (a part of the body) with one or both hands (as for protection or comfort)

dt.t: {wi}held{/wi} her ears when the train went by

dt: {bc}to continue in the same way or to the same degree {bc}{sx|last:1||}
often used in the phrase {it}hold true{/it}
{bc}to maintain a grasp on something {bc}remain fastened to something

dt.t: the anchor {it}held{/it} in the rough sea

dt: {bc}to go ahead as one has been going
{bc}to have illicit drug material in one's possession

dt.t: {it}I hold no brief for{/it} cartels and market allocations
doesn't {it}hold a candle to{/it} what she has suffered

dt: {bc}to be the center of attention among friends or admirers

dt.t: {wi}holding{/wi} forth on the subject of politics

dt: {bc}to engage one's hand with another's especially as an expression of affection
{bc}to slow down or stop for a moment
{bc}to maintain one's position {bc}prove equal to opposition

dt.t: prove I can {it}hold my own{/it} with the best of them

dt: {bc}to keep silent {bc}keep one's thoughts to oneself
{bc}to bear alone a responsibility that should have been shared by others

dt.t: She was left {it}holding the bag{/it} for their mistakes.
is {it}holding the fort{/it} until the manager returns

dt: {bc}to maintain the current position or situation
{bc}to give firm assent to {bc}adhere to strongly
{bc}to stand up under criticism or analysis

dt.t: Their version of events doesn't {it}hold water{/it}.

pt: {sc}contain{/sc} {sc}hold{/sc} {sc}accommodate{/sc} mean to have or be capable of having within. {sc}contain{/sc} implies the actual presence of a specified substance or quantity within something.

pt.t: the can {it}contains{/it} a quart of oil

pt: {sc}hold{/sc} implies the capacity of containing or the usual or permanent function of containing or keeping.

pt.t: the bookcase will {it}hold{/it} all my textbooks

pt: {sc}accommodate{/sc} stresses holding without crowding or inconvenience.

et: Middle English {it}holden{/it}, going back to Old English {it}healdan{/it}, going back to Germanic {it}*hald-a-{/it}, whence also Old High German {it}haltan{/it} "to protect, guard, hold," Old Saxon {it}haldan{/it}, Old Norse {it}halda{/it}, Gothic {it}haldan{/it} "to tend, graze (cattle)"; perhaps, if {it}-d-{/it} (going back to Indo-European {it}*-d{sup}h{/sup}-{/it}) is a root extension with resultative meaning, a derivative from the Indo-European base {it}*kelh{inf}1{/inf}-{/it} "set in motion," with sense shift from "pasture" to "keep, protect" to "hold" {ma}{mat|accelerate|}{/ma}
shortdef: to have possession or ownership of or have at one's disposal
to have as a privilege or position of responsibility
to have as a mark of distinction

dt: {bc}considered by the court to have broken the law by disobeying or disrespecting the judge

dt.t: He was {it}held in contempt{/it} for his outbursts during the trial.

shortdef: considered by the court to have broken the law by disobeying or disrespecting the judge

dt: {bc}having most stock shares and voting rights in the hands of a few

shortdef: having most stock shares and voting rights in the hands of a few

dt: {bc}to hinder the progress or achievement of {bc}{sx|restrain||}
{bc}to keep from advancing to the next stage, grade, or level
{bc}to refrain from revealing or parting with
{bc}to refrain from revealing or parting with something

shortdef: to hinder the progress or achievement of : restrain
to keep from advancing to the next stage, grade, or level
to refrain from revealing or parting with
to keep within limits
to assume or have responsibility for

dt: {bc}to defer or temporarily stop doing something

shortdef: to block from an objective : delay
to defer action on : postpone
to fight to a standoff : withstand

dt: {bc}to maintain a grasp on something {bc}{sx|hang on||}
{bc}to await something (such as a telephone connection) desired or requested
{bc}to maintain possession of or adherence to

shortdef: to maintain a condition or position : persist
to maintain a grasp on something : hang on
to await something (such as a telephone connection) desired or requested; broadly : wait

dt.t: where 30 of the … refugees were still {it}holding out{/it}

dt: {bc}to continue to function or be available {bc}{sx|last:1||}

dt.t: prayed that the engine would {it}hold out{/it}
as long as our money {it}holds out{/it}

dt: {bc}to refuse to go along with others in a concerted action or to come to an agreement

shortdef: to remain unsubdued or unyielding; also : to continue to function or be available : last
to refuse to go along with others in a concerted action or to come to an agreement
to present as something realizable : proffer

dt: {bc}to continue (as in office) for a prolonged period
{bc}to retain in a condition or position from an earlier period

dt.t: the film was {it}held over{/it} another week

shortdef: to continue (as in office) for a prolonged period
postpone, defer
to retain in a condition or position from an earlier period
